etymologies: late Middle English: Latin, literally ‘you shall have the body (in court)’

definitions: a writ requiring a person under arrest to be brought before a judge or into court, especially to secure the person's release unless lawful grounds are shown for their detention
shortDefinitions: writ requiring person under arrest to be brought before judge or into court

definitions: the legal right to apply for a habeas corpus

examples.text: Europe was first to introduce habeas corpus and the jury system

shortDefinitions: legal right to apply for such writ
